intro: Anthyllis vulneraria f. scotica, commonly known as Scottish woundwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense, globular heads, and its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets. Native to the Scottish Highlands and parts of northern England, it thrives in dry, calcareous soils and is often found in heathland and grassland habitats. This plant is known for its medicinal properties, historically used to treat wounds and skin ailments.
